info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:47PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central La Plata County through 215 PM MDT... At 146 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Durango, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central La Plata County, including the following locations... Falfa. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 550 in Colorado between mile markers 13 and 24. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 77 and 93. Colorado 172 between mile markers 22 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
